required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy And Safety Of Clopidogrel In Neonates /Infants With Systemic To Pulmonary Artery Shunt Palliation
clinical_study.official_title: International Randomized Double Blind Study Evaluating the Efficacy and the Safety of Clopidogrel 0.2 mg/kg Once Daily Versus Placebo in Neonates and Infants With Cyanotic Congenital Heart Disease Palliated With Systemic to Pulmonary Artery Shunt

brief_summary.textblock:
Contemporary management of cyanotic congenital heart disease includes three stages of surgery. Incidence of shunt thrombosis and death between the two first stages of palliation remains important.
The primary objective of the study is to evaluate the efficacy of Clopidogrel 0.2 mg/kg/day for the reduction of all cause mortality and shunt related morbidity in neonates or infants with cyanotic congenital heart disease palliated with a systemic-to-pulmonary artery shunt (e.g. modified Blalock Taussig Shunt [BTS]).
The secondary objective was to assess the safety of Clopidogrel in the study population.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this event-driven study, participants were to be randomized and treated as soon as possible after shunt placement. They were then to be treated and followed until the primary endpoint criteria was reached i.e. (shunt thrombosis, the next surgical procedure for correction of the congenital heart disease or death) or one year of age or the common study-end-date, which ever came first.
The common study-en-date was defined as the date when it was projected that 172 participants would have reached the primary endpoint criteria.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reaching Primary Endpoint Criteria (First Occurrence of Death / Shunt Thrombosis / Cardiac Procedure < 120 Days Considered of Thrombotic Nature)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Median follow-up of 5.8 months (up to a maximum of 12 months after randomization)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint was the first occurence of any of the following events: Death (including heart transplant); Shunt thrombosis requiring intervention; Hospitalization for bi-directional Glenn procedure or any cardiac related intervention prior to 120 days of age following an event or a shunt narrowing considered to be of thrombotic nature by the blinded adjudication committee. Only the first event was counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bleeding Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding events spanning from signature of the Informed Consent Form up to the last visit were collected as for any Adverse Event. The 'on-treatment' period was defined as the period from randomization up until 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever came first, and participants who experienced bleeding events during that period were counted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants According to Bleeding Type/Etiology
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: For all reported bleeding events, the type and the etiology of the bleeding event were collected. Participants who experienced bleeding events during the 'on-treatment period' were counted by bleeding type and etiology. Participants who had multiple bleedings could be counted several times.

intervention.description: Form: reconstituted solution using Clopidogrel powder Route: oral or enteric Frequency: once daily Dose: daily dose adjusted for weight
Form: reconstituted solution using matching placebo powder Route: oral or enteric Frequency: once daily Dose: daily dose adjusted for weight

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cyanotic congenital heart disease treated by any palliative systemic-to-pulmonary artery shunt.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active bleeding or increase risk of bleeding,
- Allergy to 2 or more classes of drug,
- Unable to receive drug orally or enterically,
- Current clinically significant or persistent thrombocytopenia, neutropenia, severe hepatic or renal failure.

overall_official.last_name: International Clinical Development Clinical Study Director

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment was initially planned with a minimum of 490 participants anticipating that it would continue until a total of 172 participants reaching primary endpoint criteria is achieved. Finally 906 participants were enrolled and randomized between November 2006 and October 2009 in 134 sites in 31 countries. Actual median follow-up was 5.8 months.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A participant was considered randomized when informed consent had been obtained and there was confirmation of successful allocation of a randomization number through the study treatment allocation system (Interactive Voice Response System).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Reconstituted solution using Clopidogrel matching placebo powder administered once daily with a graduated syringe in the mouth or via a feeding tube.

group.title: Clopidogrel 0.2 mg/kg/Day
group.description: Reconstituted solution using Clopidogrel powder administered once daily with a graduated syringe in the mouth or via a feeding tube. Route: oral or enteric Frequency: once daily Dose: daily dose adjusted for weight

measure.title: Type of systemic-to-pulmonary artery shunt palliation
measure.description: One participant didn't have a systemic-to-pulmonary artery shunt but underwent stenting of the right ventricular outflow track.

class.title: Modified Blalock Taussig Shunt with Norwood
Modified Blalock Taussig Shunt without Norwood

measure.title: Time from shunt palliation to randomization

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reaching Primary Endpoint Criteria (First Occurrence of Death / Shunt Thrombosis / Cardiac Procedure < 120 Days Considered of Thrombotic Nature)
outcome.description: The primary endpoint was the first occurence of any of the following events: Death (including heart transplant); Shunt thrombosis requiring intervention; Hospitalization for bi-directional Glenn procedure or any cardiac related intervention prior to 120 days of age following an event or a shunt narrowing considered to be of thrombotic nature by the blinded adjudication committee. Only the first event was counted.
outcome.time_frame: Median follow-up of 5.8 months (up to a maximum of 12 months after randomization)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the intent-to-treat (ITT) population (i.e. all randomized participants irrespective of whether or not the participant actually received study drug or the participant's compliance with the study protocol). Participants were included in the treatment group to which they were originally allocated.

measure.title: Number of Participants Reaching Primary Endpoint Criteria (First Occurrence of Death / Shunt Thrombosis / Cardiac Procedure < 120 Days Considered of Thrombotic Nature)
measure.description: The primary endpoint was the first occurence of any of the following events: Death (including heart transplant); Shunt thrombosis requiring intervention; Hospitalization for bi-directional Glenn procedure or any cardiac related intervention prior to 120 days of age following an event or a shunt narrowing considered to be of thrombotic nature by the blinded adjudication committee. Only the first event was counted.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the intent-to-treat (ITT) population (i.e. all randomized participants irrespective of whether or not the participant actually received study drug or the participant's compliance with the study protocol). Participants were included in the treatment group to which they were originally allocated.

class.title: - Cardiac procedure <120 days of thrombotic nature

analysis.groups_desc: Due to the limited knowledge in this population, 3 interim analyses were performed at approximatively 40%, 60%, 80% and 100% of of the maximum number of 172 required primary efficacy events to evaluate the effect of Clopidogrel on the primary endpoint with the potential to end the trial in case of a clear efficacy advantage for Clopidogrel. The study was designed with 80% power and an overall type I error rate of 5%.
analysis.p_value_desc: The a-priori threshold for statistical significance was < 0.035 reflecting the adjustment for interim analyses. No other adjustment for multiplicity was made.
analysis.method_desc: A two-sided log-rank test was used.
analysis.estimate_desc: The Relative Risk Reduction (Clopidogrel versus placebo) and its corresponding 95% confidence interval were estimated using Cox's proportional hazards model.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Bleeding Events
outcome.description: Bleeding events spanning from signature of the Informed Consent Form up to the last visit were collected as for any Adverse Event. The 'on-treatment' period was defined as the period from randomization up until 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever came first, and participants who experienced bleeding events during that period were counted.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever comes first
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the exposed population (i.e. all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug regardless of the amount of treatment received). Participants were included in the treatment group according to the treatment received.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Bleeding Events
measure.description: Bleeding events spanning from signature of the Informed Consent Form up to the last visit were collected as for any Adverse Event. The 'on-treatment' period was defined as the period from randomization up until 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever came first, and participants who experienced bleeding events during that period were counted.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the exposed population (i.e. all randomized participants who received at least one dose of study drug regardless of the amount of treatment received). Participants were included in the treatment group according to the treatment received.

class.title: - Serious with an outcome of death

outcome.title: Number of Participants According to Bleeding Type/Etiology
outcome.description: For all reported bleeding events, the type and the etiology of the bleeding event were collected. Participants who experienced bleeding events during the 'on-treatment period' were counted by bleeding type and etiology. Participants who had multiple bleedings could be counted several times.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization up to 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever comes first
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the same population as previously (i.e. exposed population).

measure.title: Number of Participants According to Bleeding Type/Etiology
measure.description: For all reported bleeding events, the type and the etiology of the bleeding event were collected. Participants who experienced bleeding events during the 'on-treatment period' were counted by bleeding type and etiology. Participants who had multiple bleedings could be counted several times.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the same population as previously (i.e. exposed population).

reported_events.time_frame: All Adverse Events (AE) regardless of seriousness or relationship to the drug, spanning from signature of the Informed Consent Form up to the last visit were collected.
reported_events.desc: The analysis was performed on the exposed population and included all AE that developed/worsened during the 'on-treatment period' (i.e. from randomization up to 28 days after treatment discontinuation or final follow-up visit, whichever came first).

event.sub_title: FEEDING DISORDER OF INFANCY OR EARLY CHILDHOOD

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If no publication has occurred within 12 months after trial completion, the Investigator can publish the results. Prior to publication, the sponsor shall review the manuscript and can request changes, provided they do not jeopardize the accuracy and/or the scientific value of the publication. The approval is given in writing by the sponsor, not exceeding 90 days.
